=== Purchase Information ===
Review Date: 2016/09/03
Average Rating: 4.8
Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Cassar', 'Brad Turner', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Stephen Hopkins', 'Ian Toynton', 'Frederick King Keller', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Tim Iacofano', 'Kevin Hooks'], 'Starring': ['Kiefer Sutherland', 'Kim Raver', 'Mary Lynn Rajskub'], 'Studio': ['FOX']}
Review Text: The writing, directing and acting in this series continue to be strong.  Jack Bauer is an effective problem solver and, as before, is called upon to save the complex situations in this saga.
Review Title: The Hero Keeps Going
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------

Toye', 'Craig Zisk', 'Perry Lang', 'Jeffrey Bell'], 'Starring': ['Jennifer Garner', 'Ron Rifkin', 'Michael Vartan'], 'Studio': ['ABC']} This is a fascinating program. I'm glad Amazon offers it so I can watch more than one episode at a time. The CIA or not. The truth or not. Good person or bad. That's what we get to ponder. Well acted with likable but devious characters Cliffhanger {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jack Bender', 'Peter Leto', 'David Barrett', 'Sergio Mimica-Gezzan', 'Kari Skogland', 'Eriq La Salle', 'Edward Ornelas', 'Peter Weller', 'Roxann Dawson', 'Paul A. Edwards'], 'Starring': ['Mike Vogel', 'Rachelle Lefevre', 'Natalie Martinez'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} This is a fascinating program with different personalities coping with an unusual and difficult situation I am so happy Amazon put this program on Roku so I can watch more than one episode at a time ... most of the endings are "cliff hangers" and waiting a week to see what happens would be too long Love, anger and secrets {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ben Stiller'], 'Producers': ['Scott Rudin', 'Ben Stiller', 'Stuart Cornfeld'], 'Starring': ['Ben Stiller', 'Owen Wilson', 'Christine Taylor'], 'Studio': ['Paramount Pictures']} I didn't see the whole film - just too sophomoric to waste hours on. Twelve year old boys would probably like it Too silly {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ed Bianchi', 'Nicole Kassell', 'Phil Abraham', 'Daniel Attias', 'Keith Gordon', 'Agnieszka Holland', 'Lodge Kerrigan', 'Brad Anderson', 'Patty Jenkins', 'Jonathan Demme'], 'Starring': ['Mireille Enos', 'Joel Kinnaman']} I have just started watching this series. Seattle homicide detective Sarah Linden, is asked to investigate the case of Rosie Larsen, a teenage girl who disappeared after attending a school dance on what was supposed to be Sarah's last day in Seattle. Sarah's fiance is expecting her and her daughter to come to their new home and continue wedding plans. So far, Sarah hasn't been able to get away.

The story continues as a car is pulled from a local lake and Rosie's body is in the trunk. Oh oh, the vehicle is registered to the campaign of a city councilman who is running for mayor against the incumbent. This is as far as I have gotten with Season 1 but the twists and turns will keep me coming back. Good characters and interesting plot Veronica Mars Suspense, Drama ["In the wealthy, seaside community of Neptune, California, the rich and powerful make the rules. Unfortunately for them, there's Veronica Mars, a smart, fearless 17-year-old apprentice private investigator dedicated to solving the town's toughest mysteries."] {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['John T. Kretchmer', 'Nick Marck', 'Michael Fields', 'Harry Winer', 'Jason Bloom', 'Steve Gomer', 'Guy Norman Bee', 'Marcos Siega', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Mark Piznarski'], 'Producers': ['Not Specified'], 'Starring': ['Kristen Bell', 'Percy Daggs III', 'Teddy Dunn']} This isn't a silly kids' story, but one that is fun to watch. Veronica's father was the sheriff of their small town where a wealthy man's daughter was murdered. The sheriff suspected the girl's father did it but he never had conclusive evidence. The wealthy man, embarrassed by the suspicions about him, had the sheriff fired. Veronica's father is now working as a private detective and she is his "girl Friday". Veronica's mother left them soon after the sheriff was fired and, so far, this is a continuing theme as Veronica attends high school by day and does her own detective work at night for her friends and looking for her mother.

I am a Kristen Bell fan and she does a great job as a teenage sluth. The first couple of episodes were interesting and well done. The second related somewhat to the first. Now, I have watched 3 and 4 and they are not as good and are "stand alone" episodes, so I'm only giving this one 3 stars. The hunt for Veronica's mother and the truth about why she left is the only relating factor.

I'll continue watching hoping the writers do a better job. Good story {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Norberto Barba', "Terrence O'Hara", 'Eric Laneuville', 'Aaron Lipstadt', 'Peter Werner', 'David Solomon', 'Steven DePaul', 'John Behring', 'Darnell Martin', 'Karen Gaviola'], 'Starring': ['David Giuntoli', 'Bitsie Tulloch', 'Russell Hornsby']} This series is well-acted and each episode is different, but on the same theme. I think sifi fans will like this, but I am not one of them. I did enjoy the ingenuity of the first few episodes, but then I got a little "much" for me. I think sifi fans will like this, but I am not one of them {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Grieve'], 'Starring': ['Anthony Andrews', 'Betsy Blair', 'Jane Curtin']} Love at first sight - married quickly - then the troubles begin. This is not a bad movie, but slowly adds suspicion then the end ... well, watch it with some popcorn and a cold drink ... fortunately, it is not too long. Predictable? {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Casanova, the seducer, is hired to spy on the King's mistress, Madam Pompadour. Can he stay out of trouble? I doubt it. Casing the Lady {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', 'Українська', 'Tiếng Việt', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Rosemary Rodriguez', 'Sarah Pia Anderson', 'Seth Gordon', 'Laura Innes', 'Craig Zisk', 'Michael Pressman', 'Adam Arkin'], 'Producers': ['James Degus', 'Margo Myers Massey'], 'Starring': ['Marin Ireland', 'Shane Mcrae', 'Giovanni Ribisi'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Giovanni Ribisi as a con man is perfect. He takes the identity of a former cell mate and "reunites" with his family that is in the bond business. They take him in and have him be part of their business: not stocks and bonds, but bail bonds. Of course, with his background, he is very good at this job, but Grandma is not too sure about him. Laughs, adventure and suspense! Don't miss this one {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alan Poul', 'Greg Mottola', 'Anthony Hemingway', 'Lesli Linka Glatter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Alex Graves', 'Joshua Marston', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Jason Ensler', 'Julian Farino'], 'Starring': ['Jeff Daniels', 'Emily Mortimer', 'Sam Waterston'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Big shot TV news anchor gets an unpleasant surprise when and former love is hired as his producer. It is a look at TV news production (that may or may not be true) and exciting in the Pilot. Then the next episodes become "same old, same old" as our "hero" goes from bossy to kind to unhappy lover. I've watched just a few episodes - may go back hopping for better .. or may not TV News Production behind the scenes The Tavern Drama ['Bartender Ronnie has gone from one job to another a lot over the years, and he wants to settle at a place that he can call his own. So Ronnie teams up with his friend Dave, and together they raise the money to buy a popular bar'] {'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Walter Foote'], 'Producers': ['Walter Foote', 'Johnny North', 'René Veilleux'], 'Starring': ['Cameron Dye', 'Kevin Geer']} This movie told the sad tale of 2 well meaning guys who decided to buy a bar that had a flourishing business. Getting the down payment wasn't easy. They didn't get a non-compete clause, so the original owner became their competition. Add to that chef problems, musician problems, more money problems and more. This is a great movie for teens - lots of these things wouldn't have happened had these guys taken school seriously. This movie told the sad tale of 2 well meaning guys who decided to ... {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dan Lerner', 'Christine Moore', 'Kevin Dowling', 'Adam Kane', 'Adam Arkin', 'Daniel Attias', 'Paris Barclay', 'Matt Earl Beesley', 'Allen Coulter', 'Holly Dale'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} I watched the 1st season on TV and thought it was an interesting concept. I was happy to see that Amazon offered the next season, but it is really getting weird now. The actors are excellent, but the story has the child, conceived in outer space, becoming a really spooky character. He seems to be a devil's spawn with eyes glowing yellow when he is ready to make trouble. Nice couple - bad child {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Ben Taylor'], 'Producers': ['Rob Delaney', 'Sharon Horgan', 'Richard Allen-Turner', 'Kara Baker', 'Jon Thoday'], 'Starring': ['Sharon Horgan', 'Rob Delaney']} Listed as a comedy, I didn't think it was funny. This is a unique story about a couple who thought they were having a one night stand, but made a baby. Their sense of humor and attraction to each other get them through life. So, I thought this would be a fun series, but instead it is more about there sex life. Not all that interesting and it got tiring. I watched quite a few episodes, then gave up. A Catastrophe {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Cassar', 'Brad Turner', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Stephen Hopkins', 'Ian Toynton', 'Frederick King Keller', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Tim Iacofano', 'Kevin Hooks'], 'Starring': ['Kiefer Sutherland', 'Leslie Hope', 'Sarah Clarke'], 'Studio': ['FOX']} This is a well written, directed, and acted series. This program is, sometimes, running 3 stories simultaneously and still are fully comprehensible. I'm hooked! And need more sleep. Each segment ends with a cliff hanger and I usually am up to midnight because I just have to know what happens. The events are not predictable. Great Adventure {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Jon Cassar', 'Brad Turner', 'Milan Cheylov', 'Bryan Spicer', 'Stephen Hopkins', 'Ian Toynton', 'Frederick King Keller', 'James Whitmore Jr.', 'Tim Iacofano', 'Kevin Hooks'], 'Starring': ['Kiefer Sutherland', 'Kim Raver', 'Mary Lynn Rajskub'], 'Studio': ['FOX']} The writing, directing and acting in this series continue to be strong. Jack Bauer is an effective problem solver and, as before, is called upon to save the complex situations in this saga. The Hero Keeps Going
profile:
**User Summary Update:**

- **Content Preference:** The user's strong interest in narratives with complex character dynamics and moral ambiguity remains evident. They appreciate relatable yet flawed characters and original plots, with recent interactions highlighting a preference for storytelling that balances coherent pacing with unpredictability.

- **Themes:** While they continue to favor emotional narratives involving love, betrayal, and intrigue, the user shows an enhanced sensitivity to pacing and coherence, seeking more engaging and compelling arc developments.

- **Content Advisory Tolerance:** The user maintains openness to mature themes including violence and alcohol use, reinforcing their readiness for intense narratives.

- **Viewing Behavior:** Their enjoyment of binge-watching persists, yet frustrations with humorless or monotonous shows emphasize a desire for dynamic and authentic storytelling that captivates.

- **Content Language and Accessibility:** The user prefers English audio and subtitles but demonstrates increased flexibility toward content without subtitles, indicating a willingness to explore various programming.

- **Production Quality:** Continued value is placed on high production quality from established studios. Recent experiences suggest a growing disinterest in series that emphasize sexual content over substantive storytelling, reflecting their quest for innovation and depth in narratives.

Overall, this evolving profile underscores the user's desire for engaging, original storytelling that delivers depth, maintains coherence, and avoids simplistic narratives, while still embracing mature themes and high production quality.
